scientist_messages:
role:system, messaage:The intensity at any point in the grid is determined by the superposition of signals from 3 sources.
Each source emits a signal of identical strength. 
Note that the location of the sources is unknown to us!
Make observations by specifying a single point where you want to measure the signal in a length-2 list of floating-point numbers enclosed by double brackets. 
Remember that the coordinates of the sources can be positive or negative.


Your goal is to be able to reliably predict the signal intensity (scalar-values) at any given 2-dimensional coordinate.

Here is an example:
<thought> your thought </thought>
<observe>[-0.5, 1]</observe>
When asked to answer a question about the environement, respond in the format specified in the question.
Example:
<thought> your thought </thought>
<answer> your answer </answer>

role:user, messaage:You cannot make observations now. Make assumptions and provide your best guess to the following query.

Predict the intensity at the following location: [-0.1893689   0.02026915]. 
When asked to answer a question about the environment, respond in the format specified below. Make assumptions about the environment and provide your best guess. Answer up to two decimal places.
Here is an example.
<thought> your thought </thought>
<answer>1</answer>

Answer in the following format:
<answer>ONLY a number with no explanations or text</answer>.
role:assistant, messaage:<answer>0.75</answer>
